newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel to raise $200 mln in foreign bank loan.
newsitem.headline: Israel to raise $200 mln in foreign bank loan.

text.p: Israel's General Accountant Shai Talmon has asked Israeli banks to submit proposals for raising $200 million through a consortium of foreign banks, the Treasury said.
The Treasury plans to chose the best offer in the second half of September and the loan itself will be raised towards the end of the year.
Last year the government raised 350 million Deutsche marks through a consortium of 43 foreign banks.

Talmon said the foreign currency loan will lay the groundwork for additional means of raising foreign financing in preparation for the expiration of the $10 billion U.S. loan guarantee programme in 1998.
Last Thursday Israel raised $1 billion in New York with the backing of U.S. guarantees.
The government plans to raise $200 million to $250 million in its first Eurobond offering towards the end of the year.
